intro: Polychilos amboinensis, commonly known as the Amboina polychilos, is a flowering plant native to the Moluccas in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has opposite, simple leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
